comment: This summer class was fast and the workload was overwhelming, but was clear. Weekly exams, several quizzes, and long discussion posts required time management. The exams were typically 35 question and two written responses. When responding to someone that was writing a whole new post. The professor is very specific, but fair. I could take her again
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Professor B, was great. Very helpful. Had one big paper but her progress reports on the project help you with feedback. Tests were tough but if you come to all her lectures she lets you use notes, so you must take good notes! Very straightforward. Also she's very nice, talk to her and she can help you.

Profanity isn't allowed here but I wish it were. Grading was so picky I'd call upon the divine power of the gods to help me. Minus points for overwriting. TWO 5-page papers, MIDTERM, and FINAL w/ 3 essay questions. Is open-book, but one of the most difficult tests I've ever taken. I should have dropped this one. Prof is nice but unclear w/ feedback
Very tough grader when it comes to papers and discussions, especially about citations. She's actually a good lecturer, but is very textbook focused. Feedback isn't always clear.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: I would not recommend this professor to anyone. She is an unnecessarily tough grader and takes points off for anything she can. Even if you follow the rubrics and instructions she will likely find something you did wrong. The whole criminal justice department here is a mess.
By far one of the worst professors, she is a very harsh grader on discussion post's and essay's. I would say her quizzes are very easy as well as her exam's.

She was very understanding and lenient about a lot, but there's a huge paper that takes the entire semester, and you're pretty much on your own for it. The assignments leading up to it can be confusing and not very helpful but she does provide good feedback
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Not the best class I've taken at KSU, been having several issues with utilizing grammatical tools to assist myself in writing papers which are important for the class, however, there hasn't been any kind of leeway regarding it and thus creates complications for trying to do well in the class. I'd prefer someone who is understanding about papers

I honestly don't understand the bad ratings for Dr. B! She truly cares about her students, I don't have any issues in this class. She is very good about responding and always sends reminders for assignments. This course is a little difficult with the goal of a big paper at the end, that you will be need to work on starting from the first week.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: This has to be the worst professor that I have ever had in my 4 years at KSU. Our entire class is completely struggling right now and it is mostly based on discussions. She does not have clear grading requirements and refuses to give good grades to anyone. If you do get a good grade then she will accuse you of cheating. 10/10 do not recommend!!!!

The class was fine, and the exams only consisted of past quiz questions, so they were easy. Quizzes are optional to practice for exams. The only thing is that she is a hard grader and is very specific about grading essays and discussion posts, but if you put in some effort, then you will do well.

Great overall. Gives FANTASTIC feedback on DB's/essays. A tad nitpicky, but will only take off a point or two for inconsistencies as long as you genuinely try. Her practice quizzes are a godsend-- do each one a couple of times, and you will fly through the two 100 question exams within 10 minutes. 2 opinion based papers that are quite fun to write.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy
